intro: Lepidium appelianum, commonly known as field cress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, green, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, and it produces small, round, black seeds. Lepidium appelianum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
